inputs.name: listingAddress
inputs.description: Address of the listing of which the status is being updated

abiDocs.name: updateStatus
abiDocs.notice: Updates a listing's status from 'application' to 'listing', or resolves a challenge or appeal  or appeal challenge if one exists. Reverts if none of `canBeWhitelisted`, `challengeCanBeResolved`, or `appealCanBeResolved` is true for given `listingAddress`.

inputs.name: listingAddress
inputs.description: An address for a listing to check

abiDocs.name: appealChallengeCanBeResolved
abiDocs.return: True if appeal challenge exists, has not already been resolved, and the voting phase for the appeal challenge is ended. False otherwise.
abiDocs.notice: Determines whether an appeal challenge can be resolved for a listing at given address. Throws if no challenge exists.

inputs.name: listingAddress
inputs.description: The listingAddress associated with the appeal

inputs.name: data
inputs.description: Extra data relevant to the appeal challenge. Think URLs.

abiDocs.name: challengeGrantedAppeal
abiDocs.details: challengeID is a nonce created by the PLCRVoting contract, regular challenges and appeal challenges share the same nonce variable
abiDocs.return: challengeID associated with the appeal challenge
abiDocs.notice: Starts a poll for a listingAddress which has recently been granted an appeal. If the poll passes, the granted appeal will be overturned.  -------- In order to start a challenge: 1) There is an active appeal on the listing 2) This appeal was granted 3) This appeal has not yet been challenged 4) The expiry time of the appeal challenge is greater than the current time 5) The challenger transfers tokens to the TCR equal to appeal fee paid by appeal requester -------- Initializes `Challenge` struct in `challenges` mapping -------- Emits `_GrantedAppealChallenged` if successful, and sets value of `appealChallengeID` on appeal being challenged.

inputs.name: listingAddress
inputs.description: An address for a listing to check

abiDocs.name: appealCanBeResolved
abiDocs.return: True if challenge exists, has not already been resolved, has had appeal requested, and has either  (1) had an appeal granted and passed the appeal opten to challenge expiry OR (2) has not had an appeal granted and has passed the appeal phase expiry. False otherwise.
abiDocs.notice: Determines whether an appeal can be resolved for a listing at given address. Throws if no challenge exists.

inputs.name: listingAddress
inputs.description: An address for a listing to check

abiDocs.name: challengeCanBeResolved
abiDocs.return: True if challenge exists, has not already been resolved, has not had appeal requested, and has passed the request appeal expiry time. False otherwise.
abiDocs.notice: Determines whether a challenge can be resolved for a listing at given address. Throws if no challenge exists.

inputs.name: listingAddress
inputs.description: address of listing that has challenged result that the user wants to appeal

abiDocs.name: requestAppeal
abiDocs.notice: Requests an appeal for a listing that has been challenged and completed its voting phase, but has not passed its challengeRequestAppealExpiries time. -------- In order to request appeal, the following conditions must be met: 1) voting for challenge has ended 2) request appeal expiry has not passed 3) appeal not already requested 4) appeal requester transfers appealFee to TCR -------- Initializes `Appeal` struct in `appeals` mapping for active challenge on listing at given address. Sets value in `appealRequested` mapping for challenge to true. -------- Emits `_AppealRequested` if successful

inputs.name: amount
inputs.description: The number of ERC20 tokens to increase a user's unstaked deposit by

abiDocs.name: deposit
abiDocs.notice: Allows the owner of a listingHash to increase their unstaked deposit. -------- In order to increase deposit: 1) sender of message must be owner of listing 2) Must be able to transfer `amount` of tokens into this contract -------- Emits `_Deposit` if successful

inputs.name: amount
inputs.description: The number of ERC20 tokens a user is willing to potentially stake

inputs.name: data
inputs.description: Extra data relevant to the application. Think IPFS hashes.

abiDocs.name: apply
abiDocs.notice: Allows a user to start an application. Takes tokens from user and sets apply stage end time. -------- In order to apply: 1) Listing must not currently be whitelisted 2) Listing must not currently be in application pahse 3) Tokens deposited must be greater than or equal to the minDeposit value from the parameterizer 4) Listing Address must point to owned contract 5) Sender of message must be owner of contract at Listing Address -------- Emits `_Application` event if successful

abiDocs.name: transferGovernment
abiDocs.notice: Updates IGovernment instance. -------- Can only be called by Government Controller. -------- Emits `_GovernmentTransfered` if successful.

inputs.name: listingAddress
inputs.description: The listingAddress whose status is to be examined

abiDocs.name: appWasMade
abiDocs.return: True if an address is in the application phase, or whitelisted. False if never applied or listing/application removed.
abiDocs.notice: Returns true if apply was called for this listingAddress and listing/application not yet removed

inputs.name: listingAddress
inputs.description: The listingAddress whose status is to be examined

abiDocs.name: challengeExists
abiDocs.return: True if listing has an active, unresolved challenge. False otherwise.
abiDocs.notice: Gets whether or not the given listing address has an active challenge

inputs.name: listingAddress
inputs.description: The address of the listing associated with the appeal

abiDocs.name: grantAppeal
abiDocs.notice: Grants a requested appeal.  -------- In order to grant an appeal: 1) Message sender must be appellate entity as set by IGovernment contract 2) An appeal has been requested 3) The appeal phase expiry has not passed 4) An appeal has not yet been granted -------- Updates `Appeal` struct for appeal of active challenge for listing at given address by setting `appealGranted` to true and setting the `appealOpenToChallengeExpiry` value to a future time based on current value of `challengeAppealLen` in the Parameterizer. -------- Emits `_AppealGranted` if successful

inputs.name: listingAddress
inputs.description: Address of listing to exit

abiDocs.name: exitListing
abiDocs.notice: Allows the owner of a listing to remove the listingHash from the whitelist Returns all tokens to the owner of the listing -------- In order to exit a listing: 1) Sender of message must be the owner of the listing 2) Listing must currently be whitelisted 3) Listing must not have an active challenge -------- Emits `_ListingWithdrawn` if successful

inputs.name: challengeID
inputs.description: The PLCR pollID of the challenge a reward is being claimed for

inputs.name: salt
inputs.description: The salt of a voter's commit hash in the given poll

abiDocs.name: claimReward
abiDocs.notice: Called by a voter to claim their reward for each completed vote.  -------- In order to claim reward for a challenge: 1) Challenge must be resolved 2) Message sender must not have already claimed tokens for this challenge -------- Emits `_RewardClaimed` if successful

inputs.name: voter
inputs.description: The address of the voter whose reward balance is to be returned

inputs.name: challengeID
inputs.description: The pollID of the challenge a reward balance is being queried for

inputs.name: salt
inputs.description: The salt of the voter's commit hash in the given poll

abiDocs.name: voterReward
abiDocs.details: differs from implementation in `AddressRegistry` in that it takes into consideration whether an appeal was granted and possible overturned via appeal challenge.
abiDocs.return: The uint indicating the voter's reward
abiDocs.notice: Calculates the provided voter's token reward for the given poll.

inputs.name: listingAddress
inputs.description: The listingAddress being challenged, whether listed or in application

inputs.name: data
inputs.description: Extra data relevant to the challenge. Think IPFS hashes.

abiDocs.name: challenge
abiDocs.details: Differs from base implementation in that it stores a timestamp in a mapping corresponding to the end of the request appeal phase, at which point a challenge can be resolved, if no appeal was requested
abiDocs.notice: Starts a poll for a listingAddress which is either in the apply stage or already in the whitelist.  Tokens are taken from the challenger and the applicant's deposits are locked.  Delists listing and returns 0 if listing's unstakedDeposit is less than current minDeposit

inputs.name: challengeID
inputs.description: The challengeID to query

inputs.name: voter
inputs.description: The voter whose claim status to query for given challenge

abiDocs.name: hasClaimedTokens
abiDocs.return: true if voter has claimed tokens for given challenge, false otherwise
abiDocs.notice: Getter for Challenge hasClaimedTokens mapping

inputs.name: challengeID
inputs.description: The ID of a challenge to determine a reward for

abiDocs.name: determineReward
abiDocs.return: Number of tokens awarded to winning party in a challenge
abiDocs.notice: Determines the number of tokens awarded to the winning party in a challenge.

inputs.name: listingAddress
inputs.description: The listingAddress whose status is to be examined

abiDocs.name: canBeWhitelisted
abiDocs.return: True if an application has passed its expiry without being challenged or it was challenged and the challenge has been resolved and listing is not already whitelisted. False otherwise.
abiDocs.notice: Determines whether the given listing can be whitelisted

inputs.name: listingAddress
inputs.description: Address of listing to withdraw tokens from

inputs.name: amount
inputs.description: The number of ERC20 tokens to withdraw from the unstaked deposit

abiDocs.name: withdraw
abiDocs.notice: Allows the owner of a listingHash to decrease their unstaked deposit. -------- In order to withdraw from deposit: 1) sender of message must be owner of listing 2) Amount to withdraw must be less than or equal to unstaked deposit on listing 3) Amount of tokens that would be remaining after withdrawal must be less than or equal to minDeposit from parameterizer. -------- Emits `_Withdrawal` if successful
